author: g11tech
content:
fellas, this is a small cleanup I proposed based on my discussions with <@301186049323958275> and others: 
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8316

<@543900561460822016> could you take a look and see if that PR makes sense?

author: rjected
content: this is also confusing to me imo, just calling it gas, the value burned is blobbasefee * (#blobs * "gas" per blob)

author: rjected
content: ive seen it called blobgas, but `blobbasefeeperblobgas` is verbose

author: rjected
content: if there is a less verbose way then no, if this is the least verbose way to get the idea across then yes

author: sky.cactus
content: Do you have a suggestion for a variable name that conveys a similar amount of information in less words?

author: sky.cactus
content: It is not the same as normal gas, so we can't just call it gas lest developers be confused.

author: sky.cactus
content: And it is a "fee per gas", not a total fee, so we can't call it "fee" without specifying units, lest developers be confused.

author: sky.cactus
content: I agree with your sentiment that pithy is preferred, but I'm not sure there is any room for culling the name as is.

author: rjected
content: yeah, just trying to spark some inspiration, see if anyone has better ideas than `blobbasefeeperblobgas`. Mainly just thinking through my experience of reading different implementations, and seeing the word blob, fee, and gas, blend together with everything else

author: rjected
content: like if I saw `BlobFeePerExcessBlobGasAndPricePerBlobTipCap` somewhere I would not be surprised LOL

author: g11tech
content: i think one blob can be removed `basefeeperblobgas`  as it provides sufficient context for the unit ðŸ˜†
